DataElement.preferredName: Obesity Muscle Enhancement Product Use Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more)._A single item, three part measure taken from the Growing Up Today Study (GUTS) that assesses use and frequency of various products (e.g., creatine, growth hormone, steroids) to increase muscle mass or strength in the past year._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Obesity Muscle Enhancement Product Use Questionnaire
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more)._A single item, three part measure taken from the Growing Up Today Study (GUTS) that assesses use and frequency of various products (e.g., creatine, growth hormone, steroids) to increase muscle mass or strength in the past year._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

Property.preferredDefinition: A single item, three part measure taken from the Growing Up Today Study (GUTS) that assesses use and frequency of various products (e.g., creatine, growth hormone, steroids) to increase muscle mass or strength in the past year.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: This is a single item, three part measure taken from the Growing Up Today Study (GUTS) that assesses use and frequency of various products (e.g., creatine, growth hormone, steroids) to improve muscle mass or strength in the past year.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
